title: [K-12] Computer-Based Instruction (CBI) Design and Operational Strategies for Adult Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer proficiency and foundational knowledge in educational theory
context.additional_context: Focused on cultivating CBI (Content-Based Instruction) development and operational competencies to enhance social studies education design capabilities for pre-service/in-service teachers

learning_goals: Learners can explain Computer-Based Instruction (CBI) design principles reflecting self-directed learning characteristics of adult learners with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can apply CBI strategies (autonomy provision/structured guidance) according to learning objective levels to project deliverables.
Learners can implement instructional strategies (feedback systems, mentoring structures) to support computer self-efficacy in real educational settings.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
